titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition
titlestmt.author: by H. Dean

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:21

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition consists of material related to the life and career of the American poet Archibald MacLeish received by the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library after the processing of the Archibald MacLeish Collection acquired in 1976. The Addition consists of correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, personal papers, and sound recordings documenting MacLeish and his family between 1801 and 1995.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William MacLeish, 1996 and 2006. Other material came to the library in small quantities from various sources as indicated on individual folders.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Correspondence between Archibald MacLeish and Ishbel MacLeish (box 17) and Archibald MacLeish and Ada MacLeish (boxes 1- 14) in Series IV are restricted until 21 November 2045. For further information, consult the curator.

Restricted Fragile Papers, housed in boxes 43-46 and 48-50, may be consulted only with the permission of the appropriate curator. Access copies of sound recordings for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Archibald MacLeish (1892-1982)
bioghist.p: A biographical sketch of Archibald MacLeish can be found in the finding aid for the Archibald MacLeish Collection YCAL MSS 38.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition consists of material related to the life and career of the American poet Archibald MacLeish received by the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library after the processing of the Archibald MacLeish Collection acquired in 1976. The Addition contains correspondence, writings, personal papers, and sound recordings documenting Archibald and Ada MacLeish's personal life, family history, and careers. It also contains correspondence and personal papers documenting the personal and professional life of MacLeish's parents, Andrew MacLeish and Martha Hillard MacLeish, including letters from Archibald and Ada MacLeish as well as from Archibald's siblings Bruce, Ishbel, Kenneth, and Norman. Correspondence, writings, and objects documenting MacLeish's maternal ancestors, the Hillards, and correspondence to William MacLeish (Archibald and Ada MacLeish's son) are also included.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Archibald MacLeish Collection Addition is organized into seven series: Archibald and Ada MacLeish Correspondence; Writings; Personal Papers; MacLeish Family Papers; Hillard Family Papers; William MacLeish Correspondence; and Sound Recordings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into three subseries: Letters between Ada and Archibald MacLeish, General Correspondence, and Condolence Letters. Some correspondents are present in both General Correspondence and Condolence Letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The correspondence documents the MacLeishs' relationship with each other as well as their relationships with family and friends. To a smaller extent the correspondence also evidences Archibald MacLeish's career.

scopecontent.p: Photocopies of letters from 1935 to 1964 (including 1929 letter from Dorothy Parker to Robert Benchley)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Writings are arranged into six subseries: Articles, Poetry, Playscripts, Speeches, Reviews, and Writings of Others. MacLeish's writings are arranged alphabetically by title and Writings of Others is arranged alphabetically by author (when known).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The MacLeish Family Papers are organized into three subseries: Correspondence, Writings, and Personal Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The MacLeish Family Papers contain correspondence, writings, and personal papers documenting the personal and professional life of Andrew MacLeish and Martha Hillard MacLeish (Archibald MacLeish's parents).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Sound Recordings are organized into the following three subseries: Interviews, Plays, and Poetry.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Reference copies of sound recordings are filed in the folders.
